alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 6:38AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Martin and Lawrence Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 638 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Shoals, or 13 miles southwest of Bedford, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Martin and Lawrence Counties, including the following locations... Williams, Spring Mill State Park, Mitchell, Indian Springs, Silverville, Tunnelton, Huron, Lacy and Oolitic. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
